meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose their sense of direction or position.
meanings.sent1: The maze was designed to disorient the participants.
meanings.sent2: The sudden change in the environment can disorient hikers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the riddle quickly may disorient you.
meanings.sent4: The complex instructions seemed to disorient him like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The flashing lights and loud noises were meant to disorient the enemy.

meanings.sent1: The magician used sleight of hand to disorient the audience.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected question seemed to disorient the student.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up in the schedule might disorient some attendees.
meanings.sent4: The conflicting information can disorient even the most experienced researchers.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in plans can easily disorient young children.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel disoriented.
meanings.sent1: The spinning teacup ride can disorient some people.
meanings.sent2: The medication side effects may disorient patients.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirrors can disorient visitors in a playful way.
meanings.sent4: The virtual reality game can disorient players with its immersive experience.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie can disorient viewers momentarily.
